com.viaoa.util.converter
Class OAConverterBoolean

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.util.converter.OAConverterBoolean
All Implemented Interfaces:
OAConverterInterface
public class OAConverterBoolean
extends java.lang.Object
implements OAConverterInterface

Convert to/from a Boolean value.

    Converts the following to a Boolean
  • String: if fmt is not null, then compares with true, false format values (case insensitive). If none match then null is returned. If fmt is null then returns true if value equals "true", "yes", "t", "y" (all case insensitive). Otherwise false.
  • Number: true if value != 0. Otherwise false.
  • Character: true if 't', 'y', isDigit() and not '0' (case insensitive). Otherwise false.
  • All others value will return null.

    Converts a Boolean to any of the following
  • String, using an optional format.

See Also:
OAConverter

Method Detail

convert

public java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                java.lang.Object value,
                                java.lang.String fmt)
Convert to/from a Boolean value.

Specified by:
convert in interface OAConverterInterface
Parameters:
clazz - Class to convert to.
value - if converting to boolean, then any type. If converting from boolean, then boolean value or null.
fmt - format string to determine values for true, false, null. Ex: "true;false;null", "yes;no;maybe"
Returns:
Object of type clazz if conversion can be done, else null.
